{"step_by_step_thinking": "Honey is known to contain enzymes, including diastases and amylases. Diastases and amylases are enzymes that break down complex carbohydrates into simpler sugars. Honey is made by bees from the nectar of flowers, and during the process, bees add enzymes to the nectar to convert the complex sugars into simpler sugars. These enzymes, including diastases and amylases, are naturally present in honey.", "answer_choice": "A"}
